page.title: 05ECOLOGY,TEMPERATURE
page.content: MOUNTAIN TEMPERATURES Because the Fan Frynych stations were only occupied for a short time they only provide a rough indication of the conditions which are likely to be ex- perienced at these altitudes. For the summit of Fan Frynych, the coldest month appears to have an average temp- erature of 1.7 degrees Celsius; the warmest month is about 12 degrees. The highest temperature recorded was 24 degrees and the lowest was -6.2 degrees.The average difference in temperature between the top of Fan Frynych and a station in Swansea near sea-level was 4.5 degrees C.This means that the average spring temperatures on the mountain are experienced 2 months later than in Swansea. For example,the Feb. temperatures at sea-level occur in April on the hill tops.
